alert.note: Alert for Eastern Hillsborough; Merrimack; Western And Central Hillsborough (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 1:11PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Hillsborough and southeastern Merrimack Counties through 145 PM EDT... At 110 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Weare, or 8 miles southwest of Concord, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Manchester, Bedford, Hooksett, Hopkinton, Goffstown, Weare, Bow, Allenstown and Dunbarton. This includes the following highways... Interstate 293 between mile markers 7 and 11. Interstate 93 between mile markers 24 and 32. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Hillsborough; Merrimack; Western And Central Hillsborough
